DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine if placental drainage shortens third period of labor and reduces postpartum blood lost.
DOC.brief_title: Effectiveness of Placental Drainage in the Third Stage of Labor: a Randomized Clinical Trial
DOC.detailed_description: The study aims to compare the effectiveness of placental drainage versus maintenance of maternal cord clamped end in the third stage of labor to reduce postpartum blood loss.
DOC.criteria: Low risk pregnant women Pregnancy at term Women at low risk for assisted labor / delivery and postpartum care. Live Fetus Women under 18, mentally handicapped and indigenous; Women who agreed to participate signed the Informed Consent, but evolved to cesarean section or instrumental delivery by forceps; Instrumental Delivery by forceps or csection
